i am guessing that the mysql module couldn't be loaded, look at /var/log/auth.log
fyi, it is much more common to do auth using an ldap directory than it is to use a mysql database, there is probably a lot more information on how to do that
i think the parse error means you messed up the format of /etc/pam.d/common-account
do the spaces between account and sufficient have to be tab spaces?
afaik spaces vs. tabs does not matter
wha does it mean by failed to initialise headers?
i am not sure what the problem is. I have used pam + mysql, but it was for postfix + courier, not logins
unless you're really attached to the idea of doing SQL lookups, directory services like AD and LDAP are much more common for user information, and i think there are docs for it on the ubuntu wiki
if you already use a SQL database for users and want to tie GDM into that then it would be ok, but if you are starting from scratch a directory service is probably better down the road
